titleInfo.title: Governor Cooper with officers of the Tennessee State Guard

mods.accessCondition: While TSLA houses an item, it does not necessarily hold the copyright on the item, nor may it be able to determine if the item is still protected under current copyright law. mods.abstract: Officers from the Tennessee State Guard pose on the stairs of the Tennessee State Capitol building with Governor William Prentice Cooper.

William Prentice Cooper (1895-1969), a Democrat from Bedford County, served as governor from 1939 to 1945. Before becoming governor, he was elected for one term in the state House of Representatives (1923) and was then elected district attorney. After his term as governor, he served as ambassador to Peru and as a member of the 1953 Constitutional Convention.
